heading: britain miffed
subheading: britain, reacting angrily to tuesday's army coup in pakistan, wants to suspend pakistan's membership in the commonwealth until a democratic government is restored there. the foreign office minister who urged the move said it is longstanding policy to suspend the membership of any country under military rule. nigeria and sierra leone are currently suspended for that reason. in pakistan, meanwhile, the army commander said the bloodless coup was undertaken to "prevent a national disaster."
author: wired staff
text: britain, reacting angrily to tuesday's army coup in pakistan, wants to suspend pakistan's membership in the commonwealth until a democratic government is restored there. the foreign office minister who urged the move said it is longstanding policy to suspend the membership of any country under military rule. nigeria and sierra leone are currently suspended for that reason. in pakistan, meanwhile, the army commander said the bloodless coup was undertaken to "prevent a national disaster."
